Maintain and regularly update this list of path patterns and tool-specific User-Agents using regular expression matching. Alert on occurrences and analyze for intent.

Anomalously high volume of requests, rap.Action: Monitor Zeek http.log for external source IPs accessing victim-owned websites. For each source IP, calculate: total request count, requests per unit of time (e.g., per minute/hour), and the diversity of URLs accessed (e.g., using entropy of visited paths or count of unique URLs). Use statistical methods such as Z-score, Inter-Quartile Range (IQR), or percentile-based outlier detection on these metrics to identify source IPs exhibiting significantly higher activity than established baselines or typical user behavior. Concentrated or systematic browsing of w.Action: Define URL patterns corresponding to sensitive sections of victim-owned websites (e.g., /about, /contact, /team, /staff, /careers, /investors, /api). Monitor Zeek http.log for requests from external IPs to these sections. Identify external source IPs that frequently access numerous unique pages within these defined sensitive sections within a short timeframe (e.g., >N pages in M minutes). Use descriptive statistics (e.g., count of sensitive pages visited per session/IP) and establish alert thresholds. Time series analysis of access rates to these sections can reveal unusual spikes in interest from specific sources.
